episode_title: 604 - The One Where Joey Loses His Insurance

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Rachel is packing her belongings to move to Ross’s. She’s standing in the kitchen.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So, which of this kitchen stuff is mine?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: This bottle opener. (She grabs it off of the freezer door.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: And?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: And it’s a magnet!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Look at that!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: How weird is that? Y’know? You’re moving in with me and have the one thing I don’t have. It’s like uh, in a way you-you complete me (Phoebe glares at him) kitchen.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You complete me kitchen, matey!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ross, I know what you’re thinking.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That she’s gonna move in with you and maybe then she’ll fall in love with you and then when she finds out you’re already married, she’ll just be happy. Y’know? You’re just, you’re very sad.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh…my…God! I-I see what this is! You are in love with Rachel!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What?!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Of course! It all adds up! I mean you you’re obsessed with her. It’s always, “Ross, what are you gonna do about Rachel?” “Ross, why-why are you moving in with Rachel?” “When are you gonna confess your secret marriage to Rachel?” You want her!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No! (Ross’s phone rings.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh-oh, saved by the bell. (On phone) Hello?
[Cut to the living room where Monica is helping pack a box.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey Rach, aren’t these candlesticks (holds up a pair) mine?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No-no, I bought those.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ohh! Yeah, I forgot.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah. (Rachel walks away.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That you’re a liar. (Hides the candlesticks in a drawer.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No-no-no, that’s great! I’ll be there Monday. And thank you again! (Listens) Okay. (Hangs up) (To All) Umm, that was the head of the Paleontology department at N uh, Y, uh U!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wow! Uh what, did he uh, say?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well remember that paper I had published last year on sediment flow rate, huh? They loved it.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, who wouldn’t?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I know! Anyway, they asked me to be a guest lecturer! I mean it’s temporary, but uh, if they like me it could lead to a full time job. How great would that look great on a mailbox, huh? “Professor Geller.”

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, Professor and Mrs.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: And Mrs.?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh! Yeah, y’know you and Ross are still married.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?!!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Just kidding!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh! Oh God! (Laughs her way into the living room.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Saved your ass.

content.description: Central Perk, Joey, Monica, Rachel, and Chandler are all there as Phoebe enters dejectedly.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, what’s the matter?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, you know that psychic I see?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, she told me that I’m gonna die this week, so I’m kinda bummed about that.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, and I know you guys don’t know a lot about psychic readings, but that one is pretty much the worse one you can get.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Phoebe that’s crazy!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I can’t believe she would say that too you.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah honey you don’t believe her do you?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I don’t—she said y’know that I’d have triplets! But she also said one of them would be black.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Just out of curiosity did she tell you how you’re gonna go?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, ‘cause she didn’t tell me I was gonna die until the very end of the session, and I was not gonna waste a whole another hour there! I mean I’ve only got a week left, y’know? I’ve really gotta start living now! (So she picks up the latest copy of Car and Driver (a U.S. auto magazine), leans back, and starts reading.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey everyone!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh hi!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey uh, well, today’s my first lecture and I kinda wanted to try it out on you guys, do you, do you mind?
(They pause to think about it.)

content.speaker: All
content.text: Oh that’d be great. Sure!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: “There are three primary theories concerning sediment flow rate. Each of these theories can be further subcategorized into two distinct…”
content.parenthetical: he starts reading directly from his cards word for word very quietly

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, this is it. This what’s gonna kill me.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: “…subcategories. The first of these subcategories is…”

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uh Ross! Are there uh, are there naked chicks on that piece of paper?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No! Why?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, I’ve just never seen a guy stare so hard at a piece of paper that didn’t have naked chicks on it.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ohh! Okay! Okay. (Resumes reading word for word from the card) “There are three (pauses and looks at Joey) primary theories concerning sediment flow rate. (Pauses and darts his eyes between Chandler and Rachel.) (Rachel starts laughing) Each of these theories (glances at Phoebe) can be further subcategorized (glances at Chandler) into…”

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Why don’t you open with a joke?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Open with a joke? It’s a university, not a comedy club!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Wait a minute, hold the phone! You’re not talking about Chuckles University?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay!

content.speaker: All
content.text: Ohh! We’re kidding! Oh, we’re kidding!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross, hey you know what might make it less boring?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Thank you!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Some uh, some visual aides.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh-ooh-ooh! Y’know what’s a good visual aide?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Please don’t say naked chicks.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Why not?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I-I-I don’t even know why I bother to talk to you guys about it. Y’know what? I’m just gonna do it on my own with no naked chicks.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That’s the way I did it ‘til I was 19.

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Joey is playing that string game with the two hands and the weird crossing patterns as Chandler enters with the mail.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey! Any good mail?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes, you got something from the Screen Actor’s Guild.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ooh, it’s probably a residual check, hey can you open it for me, I’m kinda…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: “Benefits lapsed.”

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hmm that’s weird. I don’t remember being in a move called benefits lapsed.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, it’s not a check. They’re saying your health insurance expired because, you didn’t work enough last year.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Let me see that!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, I can’t believe this! This sucks! When I had insurance I could get hit by a bus or catch on fire, y’know? And it wouldn’t matter. Now I gotta be careful?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m sorry man, there’s never a good time to (pauses) stop catching on fire.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right well, I guess I gotta go get a job. I’m gonna go see my agent.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, make sure you look both ways before you cross the street.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: …look both ways before you cross the street. (Turns and walks headlong into the closed door.)
content.parenthetical: mocks him, in a whiney voice

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Phoebe enters to find Rachel still packing.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey Pheebs, you’re still alive! How are you doing?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ugh, it’s so exhausting waiting for death. Ohh, by the way, do you think you could—(Groans, hacks, and then freezes with her eyes open and her tongue hanging out.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Pheebs, what-what are you doing?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I was preparing you for my—didn’t you think I was dead? Did that not come off?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh yeah, scared the hell out of me. I thought we’d lost you forever. Pheebs, you lie down?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, thanks. And listen, can you do me a favor? Could you just umm, wake me up in a couple hours, y’know if you can.
(Phoebe goes and lies down as Rachel opens the drawer Monica hid the candlesticks in and as Monica walks out of her room.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Monica!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hmm? (Rachel holds up the candlesticks.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Did-did you take these back?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No-no, I-I just, I liked them so much that I went out and bought some for myself.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh yeah, they’re really great! Aren’t they?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I loved them!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah. (Monica walks away) Nice try! (Rachel puts them in a box.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hello!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: How’d the lecture go?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It went great! And I didn’t need any jokes or naked chicks either!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wow, that’s great Ross, I’m sorry we weren’t more supportive before.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I knew all I had to do was let the material speak for itself. Everyone’s all, “Ross you have to be funny and sexy.” Well, I proved them wrong! And now, I’m gonna pass the news onto Joey and Chandler.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That you’re not funny or sexy?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’s right!

content.description: Estelle Leonard Theatrical Agency, Joey is there to see his agent.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey Estelle, listen…

content.speaker: Estelle
content.text: Well! Well! Well! Joey Tribbiani! So you came back huh? They think they can do better but they all come crawling back to Estelle!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What are you talkin’ about? I never left you! You’ve always been my agent!

content.speaker: Estelle
content.text: Really?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Estelle
content.text: Oh well, no harm, no foul.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Estelle, you gotta get me some work. I-I lost my health insurance.

content.speaker: Estelle
content.text: All right, first thing we gotta do, damage control.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Why?

content.speaker: Estelle
content.text: Well, I think uhh, someone out there may have been bad mouthing you all over town.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Bastard!

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Chandler enters to find Joey lying in the fetus position on the floor.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey! So Estelle lined up a bunch of auditions for me tomorrow and I’ll have my health insurance back in no time.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That’s great, but shouldn’t you be on the toilet right now?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What’s wrong with you?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Nothing! Well, I-I got this blinding pain in my stomach when I was lifting weights before, then I uh passed out and uh, haven’t been able to stand up since. But um, I don’t think it’s anything serious.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: This sounds like a hernia. You have to—you-you go to the doctor!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No way! ‘Kay look, if I have to go to the doctor for anything it’s gonna be for this thing sticking out of my stomach! (Rolls over and shows Chandler.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That’s a hernia.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Why did I have to start working out again? (Looks at the weights he was using.) Damn you 15s!

content.description: a NYU lecture hall, Rachel and Monica are arriving to talk to Ross after the lecture, but are there early.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, we’re a little early, the lecture doesn’t end for 15 minutes.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, but y’know we could sneak in and watch.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, we could. Oh hey look! There’s some Kappa Kappa Deltas! I was a Kappa. (to them) Hey sisters! (They ignore her.) (To Monica) Wow, we really are bitches.
(They enter the lecture hall to find Ross speaking in an English accent for some unknown reason.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Right! So when Rigby got his samples back from the laboratory he made a startling discovery! What he believed to be igneous, was in fact sedimentary. Imagine his consternation when—(sees Monica and Rachel.) Oh bloody hell.

content.description: a NYU lecture hall, the scene is continued from earlier, only Ross has dismissed the class and is now talking to Monica and Rachel.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What the hell are you doing?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look, I was nervous! You guys had me all worried I was going to be boring! I got up there and they were all like staring at me. I opened my mouth and this British accent just came out.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, and not a very good one.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Will you-will you please?
(Another professor walks down from the back of the lecture hall.)

content.speaker: The Professor
content.text: Dr. Geller, Kurt Rathman, I’m a professor in the paleontology department here.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh.

content.speaker: The Professor
content.text: Do you have a moment to talk about your lecture?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m sorry, I’ve got plans with my sister.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Monica Gellerrr. (She rolls her ‘R’)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Right, will you excuse us for one moment? (Takes Monica aside.) (In his normal voice.) What are you doing?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, you can have an accent and I can’t?! (To an exiting student in accent.) Top ‘O the morning to ya laddies!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Just please stop!
(They turn back to Rachel and Professor Rathman.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes, yes, Bombay is bery, bery nice time of year.

content.description: Central Perk, Chandler is reading on the couch while Joey, still suffering from his hernia, is returning with coffee for them both. After a series of grunts and groans he manages to painfully walk back from the counter, sit down, and slide Chandler his coffee.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, will you grab me a cruller? (Joey starts to groan and get up.) Sit down! Will you go to the hospital?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Dude! Hernia operations cost like, a lot probably. Besides it’s getting darker and more painful, that means it’s healing.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I will loan you the money. Just go to the hospital and let’s just get that thing…pushed back in.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Thank you, but it would take me forever to pay you that money back and I don’t want that hanging over my head. Okay? Besides, as soon as my insurance kicks in I can get all the free operations I want! Yeah, I’m thinking I’ll probably start with that laser eye surgery too.
(Phoebe enters.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What’s going on?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh Joey’s got a really bad hernia, but that’s nothing a little laser eye surgery won’t fix!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Look, I’m telling you if I put my hand on my stomach right here (He puts his hand down his pants, like Al Bundy on Married…With Children always used to do.) it doesn’t hurt that bad.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey! Maybe you’ll die!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Sure, now I’m scared.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, we can go together! Just don’t wait too long though, okay? ‘Cause I’m outta here sometime before Friday.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, but I don’t wanna die!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No-no, it’ll be fun! We can come back and we can haunt these guys!

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Monica and Rachel are having a tug-of-war over the disputed candlesticks.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Gimme ‘em!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No! They are mine!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You stole them from me!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You stole them from me!!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Gimme them!
(With one last mighty tug the combatants lose their grip and split, each holding one candlestick.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You just wanna each take one?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah that seems fair. We never use them.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look, I really need some help, okay? Why? Why did I have to speak in a British accent?! What do I do?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Why don’t you phase it out? Yeah, fade the accent out and people will think you’re, y’know, that you’re adjusting to life in America.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, I mean, come on Ross, no one will even notice. I mean they’re probably not even listening!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: They’re not listening too me?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Of course they’re listening to you! Everybody listens to you.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Monica you really think I should try this phasing out thing?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I think you look fine.

content.description: Casting Director #1’s office, Joey is on his first audition. His partner is an 8-year-old boy.

content.speaker: Casting Director #1
content.text: Whenever you’re ready.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay. “Hey, Timmy, I’ve got a surprise for you.”

content.speaker: Casting Director #1
content.text: Hold it. I’m sorry, the surprise is a new swing set, if you could play it a little less…intense?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh yeah, sure, no problem, I’ll just—hold on one second. (He turns around and puts his hand in his pants and groans in relief.) (In a relaxed voice.) “Hey Timmy, I’ve got a surprise for you!”

content.speaker: Casting Director #1
content.text: Oh my God!!
(Joey pulls his hand out and reverts back to intense pain.)

content.description: [Scene: Casting Director #2’s office, Joey is on his second audition. This one is for Purina One Dog Chow, an actual item. Please note the gratuitous product placement.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So that’s why I feed my dog Purina One ! Pick up a bag today! (He turns, looks at the bag and realizes he won’t be able to pick it up.)

content.speaker: Casting Director #2
content.text: That’s where you pick up the bag.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Exactly.

content.speaker: Casting Director #2
content.text: No, the line is pick a bag, so you need to pick up the bag.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Or, I could just point to it! Huh? Blah, blah, blah, Purina One , point to a bag today. (She just looks at him.) I didn’t get it, did I?

content.speaker: Casting Director #2
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, okay. (Leaves)

content.description: Casting Director #3’s office, Joey is entering.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hi. I’m Joey Tribbiani; I’m here to audition for (Groans) man.

content.speaker: Casting Director #3
content.text: You mean dying man?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yes!

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Monica and Rachel are playing phone pranks on Ross.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, come on, do it one more time!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Really? Really?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yes!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay! (Picks up the phone and starts dialing.) (In an Irish accent) “Hello Ross, this is Dr. McNeeley from the Fake Accent University, we’d like you to come on board with us full time! (Hangs up.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Listen to this! My reading was wrong, I’m not going die!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Really?! How do you know?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Because my psychic is dead! She must’ve read the cards wrong!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, I’m sorry.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Eh, better her than me! Hey, let’s bake cookies!

content.description: Silvercup Studios, Joey has won the part of dying man and is now able to play the role he was injured for. Chandler is helping to carry him in.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Listen, I’m really glad you got the part.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Thank you.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: But are you sure you can do this?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah! And hey, thanks for coming with me. And thanks again for helping me take a shower.
(Chandler steps away quickly.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Now, is that never talking about it again?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hiya!

content.speaker: The Director
content.text: Hey Joey, we’re ready for ya! (Joey stumbles over) Joey, this is Alex he’s going to be playing your son.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hi Alex! (to the director) And uh, as you can see my hands are not in my pants. (Holds them both up.)

content.speaker: The Director
content.text: Okay. (to Alex) All right uh, Alex now when Joey says his line, “Take good care of your Momma son,” that’s your cue to cry. Got it? (Alex nods yes.) All right, let’s do this.
(Joey lies down on the gurney.)

content.speaker: A Crew Member
content.text: Scene 5, take 1.

content.speaker: The Director
content.text: And Action!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: “Take could care of your Momma son.” (Alex just looks at him and the director motions for him to continue so he tries it again.) “Take could care of your Momma son.” (Alex does nothing.) “Come on son! Your Momma’s good people!”

content.speaker: The Director
content.text: Cut! Alex, remember you’re supposed to cry. Can you cry for us this time?

content.speaker: Alex
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: The Director
content.text: All right, from the top.

content.speaker: A Crew Member
content.text: Scene 5, take 2.
[Time lapse.]

content.speaker: A Crew Member
content.text: Take 36 is up!

content.speaker: The Director
content.text: All right! Let’s try this again! You ready Joe?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ah, just one thing umm, is it all right with you if I, if I scream right up until you say action?

content.speaker: The Director
content.text: Uh sure.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay. (Starts screaming.)

content.speaker: The Director
content.text: Action!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: “Take good care of your Momma son.” (Again Alex does nothing.)

content.speaker: The Director
content.text: Cut!!!!!!!!!! (Joey starts screaming again.)
(Chandler decides to help out.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m sorry! Hey-hey Joe, why don’t you uh, lift up your shirt? (He does.) Take a look at this kiddo. (Alex finally starts crying.) We have a crying child ! Roll the damn cameras !

content.description: Ross and Rachel’s apartment, Rachel is unpacking as the phone rings.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hello?

content.speaker: Russell
content.text: Hello, is Ross there?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uh no, he’s not. Can I take a message?

content.speaker: Russell
content.text: Yes, this Russell, Ross’s divorce lawyer, just tell him that since I haven’t heard from him, I assume he’s decided to give the marriage a try.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross got married again—Nooooooo!!!!!!!!!

content.description: a NYU lecture hall, Ross is trying to phase out his accent.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: All right, keep going. We are phasing the accent out, phasing it out. So without out re-testing the results in the laboratory (pronounced the British way) the team would never have identified (British) the initial errors in their carbon dating analysis (British). Were there any questions at this point? (One student raises his hand.) Yes. (Points to him.)

content.speaker: A Student
content.text: What’s happening to your accent?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Come again? What’s-what’s this nonsense? (Giggles.) (American.) All right, I’m-I’m not English. I’m from Long Island. I was really nervous and the accent just uh, just came out. I’m sorry. So, if we could just get back to the lecture. Umm, were there any questions? (Everyone raises their hands) About paleontology. (They all put their hands down.) All right, look I was just trying to make a good first impression. Obviously, I screwed up. But what you guys think of me is really important because I’m-I’m hoping to get a permanent job here. So if you just give me another chance to make a good impression…
(At this moment Rachel bursts through the door. Needless to say, she’s not in the best of moods having just found out Ross’s dirty little secret.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross!! Are you crazy?! I am still your wife!! What, were you just never gonna tell me?!! What the hell is wrong with you?!!!! Ugh, I could just kill you!!!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, hello Rachel!

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Joey is holding a football helmet; and apparently, in a rather disgusting scene, Joey wants Phoebe to beat him senseless. (Luckily it isn’t a long trip.) Because he’s made a miraculous recovery from his hernia and wants to take advantage of all those free surgeries he can get now since he’s re-established his health insurance.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Have you really done this before?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah! Yeah! Yeah! You just take a big, big swing. Now, don’t hold back. (He dons his protective helmet (Why, I have no clue.) and Phoebe picks up a wooden baseball bat and starts to swing as Chandler and Monica enter.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey-hey-hey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What are you doing?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: We’re just celebrating that Joey got his health insurance back.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, all right.
(Decided that they are less than human as well, Chandler picks up a golf club and Monica a frying pan, to join in on the fun of beating their good friend to within an inch of his life!)
